abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Project for St.
            Vincent and the Grenadines had a satisfactory outcome, is
            likely to be sustainable, and has a modest institutional
            development impact. The performances of both the Bank and
            the Borrower are rated as satisfactory. Among the lessons
            noted are: 1) The Bank is well positioned to respond to
            similar emergencies in the future. 2) The Bank can play an
            active role to assist countries in meeting established and
            evolving regulatory standards. 3) There can be significant
            advantages to implementing multi-country programs through a
            regional entity. 4) Regional procurement can bring important
            cost-benefits. 5) Emergency projects benefit from close supervision.
